poem:
Clemency  

In shadows where bars hold silence,  
voices rise, tender and cracked.  
They plead for light—  
weary breath against cold steel.  
In the garden of indifference,  
blossoms of mercy tremble,  
waiting for hands to bear them  
gently to the sun,  
to grant a chance,  
to plant a seed.  
Freedom whispers through the lock.
